column1:
#Text=# Vec2Sent
Probing Sentence Embeddings with Natural Language Generation
#Text=We introspect black-box sentence embeddings by conditionally generating from them with the
#Text=objective to retrieve the underlying discrete sentence.
#Text=We perceive of this as a new unsupervised
#Text=probing task and show that it correlates well with downstream task performance.
#Text=how the language generated from different encoders differs.
#Text=You can quickly install Vec2Sent using pip:
#Text=There are three entry points to **generate** and **evaluate** sentences, and to perform **arithmetic** in the vector space.
#Text=Please enter sentence a (Or nothing if done):his name is robert
#Text=Please enter sentence b (Or nothing if done):he is a doctor
#Text=Please enter sentence c (Or nothing if done):her name is julia
#Text=Please enter sentence d (Or nothing if done):
#Text=For example, generate outputs using the hierarchical sentence embedding
#Text=The outputs from the previous step can now be evaluated.
#Text=For example, the following command computes the bleu score
#Text=| ID        | Fraction of all sentences where the output is identical to the input              |
#Text=| PERM      | Fraction of all output sentences that can be formed as a permutation of the input |
#Text=| ID_PERM   | Fraction of all permuations that are identical to the input                       |
#Text=| MOVER     | Average Mover Score between input and output sentences                            |
#Text=> Vec2Sent needs to download several gigabites of sentence embedding models.
#Text=Those files can be deleted using the command `vec2sent_cleanup`
#Text=We upload our models to the Hugging Face Hub.
#Text=The following table shows, which parameters to set in order to load the sentence embeddings and corresponding Vec2Sent models
#Text=| avg                          | maruker/vec2sent-avg         | Average pooling on [BPEmb](https://github.com/bheinzerling/bpemb) word embeddings |
#Text=Additional sentence embeddings can be used by extending the class ``vec2sent.sentence_embeddings.abstract_sentence_embedding.AbstractEmbedding``.
#Text=# Download git submodules (MoS model and some sentence embeddings)
#Text=If you find Vec2Sent useful in your academic work, please consider citing
#Text=    title = "{V}ec2{S}ent: Probing Sentence Embeddings with Natural Language Generation",
#Text=    booktitle = "Proceedings of the 28th International Conference on Computational Linguistics",
#Text=    abstract = "We introspect black-box sentence embeddings by conditionally generating from them with the objective to retrieve the underlying discrete sentence.

column1: #Text=The models are based on [Mixture of Softmaxes](https://github.com/zihangdai/mos) with a context vector added to the inputs.
